1:
A gentle answer turns away wrath,\q but a harsh word stirs up anger.
\q
2:
The tongue of wise people compliments knowledge,\q but the mouth of fools pours out folly.


\q
3:
The eyes of Yahweh are everywhere,\q keeping watch over the evil and the good.
\q
4:
A healing tongue is a tree of life,\q but a deceitful tongue crushes the spirit.


\q
5:
A fool has contempt for his father's instruction,\q but he who learns from correction is prudent.
\q
6:
In the house of the righteous person there is great treasure,\q but the earnings of the wicked person give him trouble.


\q
7:
The lips of wise people scatter knowledge about,\q but not so the hearts of fools.
\q
8:
Yahweh hates the sacrifices of wicked people,\q but the prayer of upright people is his delight.


\q
9:
Yahweh hates the way of wicked people,\q but he loves the one who pursues what is right.
\q
10:
Harsh discipline awaits anyone who forsakes the way\q and he who hates correction will die.


\q
11:
Sheol and destruction are open before Yahweh;\q how much more the hearts of the sons of mankind?
\q
12:
The mocker resents correction;\q he will not go to the wise.


\q
13:
A joyful heart makes the face cheerful,\q but heartache crushes the spirit.
\q
14:
The heart of the discerning seeks knowledge,\q but the mouth of fools feeds on folly.


\q
15:
All the days of oppressed people are miserable,\q but a cheerful heart has an unending feast.
\q
16:
Better is little with the fear of Yahweh\q than great treasure with confusion.

\q
17:
Better is a meal with vegetables where there is love\q than a fatted calf served with hatred.
\q
18:
An angry man stirs up arguments,\q but a person who is slow to anger quiets a quarrel.

\q
19:
The path of the sluggard is like a place with a hedge of thorns,\q but the path of the upright is a built-up highway.
\q
20:
A wise son brings joy to his father,\q but a foolish person despises his mother.


\q
21:
Folly delights a person who lacks sense,\q but the one who has understanding walks a straight path.
\q
22:
Plans go wrong where there is no advice,\q but with numerous advisors they succeed.

\q
23:
A person finds joy when he gives a pertinent reply;\q how good is a timely word!
\q
24:
The path of life leads upward for prudent people,\q that they may turn away from Sheol beneath.


\q
25:
Yahweh tears down the legacy of the proud,\q but he protects the property of the widow.
\q
26:
Yahweh hates the thoughts of wicked people,\q but the words of kindness are pure.


\q
27:
The robber brings trouble to his family,\q but the one who hates bribes will live.
\q
28:
The heart of the righteous person ponders before it answers,\q but the mouth of wicked people pours out all its evil.


\q
29:
Yahweh is far away from wicked people,\q but he hears the prayer of righteous people.
\q
30:
The light of the eyes brings joy to the heart\q and good news is health to the body.


\q
31:
If you pay attention when someone corrects how you live,\q you will remain among wise people.
\q
32:
The one who rejects discipline despises himself,\q but he who listens to correction gains understanding.


\q
33: The fear of Yahweh teaches wisdom\q and humility comes before honor.
